---
title: Gradient
description: "A numerical value that informs us how to adjust a parameter of the model."
---

---

The gradients update the parameters by multiplying the two together. How much the gradients update the parameters is controlled by the [learning rate](learning_rate.qmd).

A positive gradient tells us that increasing the parameters will increase the [loss](loss.qmd). On the other hand, decreasing the parameters will decrease the [loss](loss.qmd).

A negative gradient tells us that decreasing the parameters will increase the [loss](loss.qmd) On the other hand, increasing the parameters will decrease the [loss](loss.qmd).
